{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3170834,"name":"","username":"Wing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wing/{size}/175245_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-22T23:34:55.508Z","cooked":"

So i’ve tried using both the phoenix tuner application and code itself but I still havent gotten a falcon to move with set position. If i make a method that sets the position of a falcon and bind that to a button is does nothing. When I try moving a motor using position control in phoenix tuner it also does nothing. Does anybody have any ideas?

I did, well at least I think I did by doing it like this:

intakeMotor.configSelectedFeedbackSensor(
FeedbackDevice.IntegratedSensor, 0, Settings.timeoutMs);
intakeMotor.config_kP(0, 0.1); etc

If you aren’t using tuner pro you have to keep in mind there are 2048 ticks per rev on a falcon so 360degrees =2048 ticks. So if you are only setting it to 30 thinking that is 30 degrees it is not and may not result in any motion
